title: Dopefish lives on
content:
just wanted to show you my little easter egg i used in a game i (and others) made at my game creation school.

[img]http://img280.imageshack.us/img280/2884/apartment01px8.jpg[/img]

spot the Dope Fish in the graffiti! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopefish.gif[/img]

title: Re: Dopefish lives on
content: Game creation school?[center]<font color="MAROON">TOUGH GUYS DON'T FOLLOW FADS</font>[/center]

title: Re: Dopefish lives on
content:
yeah, we learn to make games.
or more correctly, i'm studying 3dgraphics. you can also study programming and sometimes we work togheter with projects (usually creating a game). but i am no programmer, just a
graphic artist.

title: Re: Dopefish lives on
content:
Would this game happen to be one where you run around shooting the other players with guns? Because I didn't realise we were so short on such games that we needed to train people to make more of them... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

(No seriously, tell us more about your games. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] )----------
www.StrifeStrips.com! Woot! We're back, baby!

title: Re: Dopefish lives on
content:
ofcourse it's a gun-down game!
but it wasn't my idea, i was just a simple graphics artist [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-disguised.gif[/img]
the game is about angels and demon fighting over what's left of the earth, with guns!! there are many aspects of this game i din't like (like the use of guns wtf?) but it turned out nice for being our first game. it's just a demo level though.


for the next project i will get the chance of contributing with my own concept for a game, i want to create something platformish with lots of atmosphere (sorry not a keen game). since platformers are a lost genre these days and oldskool atmospheric games are hard to find, i really feel for the concept i have in mind.

but i won't tell you what it is at this point [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

title: Re: Dopefish lives on
content:
Spotted! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Looks nice work. And, especially nice to hear someone is still thinking about platforming games! Good luck with that!3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Dopefish lives on
content:
Nice render. Nice hidden Dopefish. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] ____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Re: Dopefish lives on
content:
Nice, will your game be freeware?-----------------
[img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/s/jcw/img/logo_jamster_navi.gif[/img][img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/storage/view/335/0/cr/CrazyFrog___Axel_F_Falling.gif[/img]

title: Re: Dopefish lives on
content:
And here I was, thinking that Heaven and Hell had powers that were greater than little pieces of metal hurtling through the air. Silly me! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rolleyes.gif[/img] ----------
www.StrifeStrips.com! Woot! We're back, baby!

title: Re: Dopefish lives on
content: the game is freeware but i don't think anyone have put it on the net for download. i think the game is to big for "simply hosting it" so to speak.
